purpose.p: Declares a named key to be used with the key() function.

usage.p: Using the xsl:key declaration simplifies code and can increase performance, since most implementations build an index the first time the key is processed.
Keys may be of any data type, and values can be evaluated in a sequence constructor inside the xsl:key instead of using a use attribute setting.

property.name: use
property.description: An expression used to determine the key value(s)

property.name: collation
property.description: The name of a collation used to compare the value of keys

examples.codeblock: <xsl:key name="identifier" match="entry" use="@xml:id"/> ... <xsl:template match="link"> <xsl:variable name="linkID" select="@href"/> <xsl:variable name="linkmeta" select="key('identifier',$linkID,$resourcelist)"/> ... </xsl:template>
